info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 9:51AM EDT until June 14 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Pennsylvania, including the following county, Crawford.
* WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 951 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Meadville, Titusville, Cambridge Springs, Linesville, Guys Mills, Harmonsburg, Lincolnville, Atlantic, Canadohta Lake, Riceville, Adamsville, Pymatuning North, Pymatuning Central, Cochranton, Saegertown, Conneautville, Conneaut Lake, Hydetown, Springboro and Blooming Valley.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
